pattern: User pointed out a failure to update a contact name after being told it was completed.
resolution: Acknowledge the failure directly. Explain that the system lacks a direct EDIT/UPDATE contact function. The correct procedure is to create a new, correct contact and advise the user that the old, incorrect one must be manually deleted. Do not claim to "update" a record when the only tool available is "create".

pattern: "{\"company_name\":\"Armexa\",\"activity_type\":\"general\",\"description\":\"CORRECTION to previous note: The lead mentioned, \\\"Max\\\", who raised $100M for reentry projects in Louisiana, is a contact of Bill's (the user), not Josh's. Bill was the one who offered to connect Josh with Max as a potential opportunity.\",\"title\":\"CORRECTION to note on Josh Ruff: Source of 'Max' Lead\"}"

User corrected speaker attribution in a transcribed conversation summary. The AI summary stated a lead came "from Josh" when the user stated "that is actually me saying I want to connect Josh with Max."
resolution: When summarizing a transcribed conversation between the user (Bill) and a contact, correctly attribute statements. The user offering a connection is the source of the lead. The CRM note must reflect that the user is providing the lead TO the contact. The new note should explicitly state this correction.

pattern: User pointed out incorrect company information from a URL.
resolution: When a user provides a URL for a company and asks what they do, I must use the scrape_url tool to get live, accurate data. I must not rely on cached or potentially outdated internal knowledge. The user's frustration was justified because I failed to perform the direct action they requested.
